TitlePart.Title: To qualify as a beach lifeguard you must have a good level of fitness and be able to swim in the sea to take the National Vocational Beach Lifeguard Qualification. You'll also be expected to meet more standards, such as:completion of a 400m pool swim

Description.Html:
To qualify as a beach lifeguard you must have a good level of fitness and be able to swim in the sea to take the National Vocational Beach Lifeguard Qualification. You'll also be expected to meet more standards, such as:

  • completion of a 400m pool swim in less than eight minutes
  • making a surface dive to a depth of 1.5 metres
  • treading water for two minutes
  • climbing out of deep water unaided

data.DisplayText: To qualify as a beach lifeguard you must have a good level of fitness and be able to swim in the sea to take the National Vocational Beach Lifeguard Qualification. You'll also be expected to meet more standards, such as:completion of a 400m pool swim

TitlePart.Title:
You may need to get a Certificate of Professional Competence - a
[Driver CPC] - if you're the operator of a haulage or transport business.

Description.Html: You may need to get a Certificate of Professional Competence - a Driver CPC - if you're the operator of a haulage or transport business.

TitlePart.Title: You'll need a license from your [local council], if you start modelling before the legal school leaving age.

TitlePart.Title: You may have to pass enhanced background checks if your work is related to national security.
